columns.text:
In this exercise, we are asked to determine the projected gains or
losses at the current exchange rate, when the exchange rate changes, and what exchange rate is needed to accomplish break even.
**Exchange rate** is the value of a currency when *expressed in another country's currency*.

## a.

We are asked to determine the company's projected gains or losses from this proposed arrangement at the current exchange rate of $1.09/€.

We are given the following data:
- The sales is approximately €5.7 million per month.
- Jarek, a dealer,  will retain 5% of retail sales as a commission. It will be paid in euros.
- At the current exchange rate, the company would spend 80% of the sales on production costs. This excludes the sales commission of Jarek.

First, we need to identify the identify the gross profit in euros. We will deduct the sales commission of Jarek and the production cost from the sales. To visualize:

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Sales}&&\text{€ xx~}\\
\text{Sales Commission of Jarek}&&\text{(xx)}\\
\text{Production Cost}&&\underline{\text{(xx)}}\\
\text{Gross Profit in €}&&\underline{\underline{\text{€ xx~}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Next, we will identify the commission of Jarek by multiplying the sales and the percentage of sales commission.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Sales Commission} &= \text{Sales}\times{\text{\% Sales Comission}}\\
&= \text{ € 5,700,000}\times{\text{5\%}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{ € 285,000}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

 
The sales commission of Jarek is **€ 285,000**.

Next, we will identify the production cost which is 80% of the sales.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Production Cost} &= \text{Sales}\times{\text{\% in Sales}}\\
&= \text{ € 5,700,000}\times{\text{80\%}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{ € 4,560,000}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

 
The production cost is **€ 4,560,000**.

We can now determine the gross profit in euros:

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Sales}&&\text{€ 5,700,000~}\\
\text{Sales Commission of Jarek}&&\text{(285,000)}\\
\text{Production Cost}&&\underline{\text{(4,560,000)}}\\
\text{Gross Profit in €}&&\underline{\underline{\text{~~~~€ 855,000}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Lastly, we will convert the gross profit in euros to dollars using the exchange rate of $1.09. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Gross Profit in \$} &= \text{Gross Profit in € }\times{\text{Exchange Rate}}\\
&= \text{ € 855,000}\times{\text{\$ 1.09}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{ \$ 931,950}}\\
\end{aligned}$$
As a conclusion, the projected gain from the proposed arrangement at the current exchange rate of $1.09/€ is **\$ 931,950**.

## b. 

We are asked to determine the company's projected gains or losses from this proposed arrangement if the exchange rate is $1.03/€.

We are given the following data:
- The sales is approximately €5.7 million per month.
- Jarek, a dealer,  will retain 5% of retail sales as a commission. It will be paid in euros.
- At the current exchange rate, the company would spend 80% of the sales on production costs. This excludes the sales commission of Jarek.

First, we need to determine the value of the production cost which is 80% of the sales.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Production Cost} &= \text{Sales}\times{\text{\% in Sales}}\\
&= \text{ € 5,700,000}\times{\text{80\%}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{ € 4,560,000}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

 

The production cost is **€ 4,560,000**.

Next, we need to convert the production cost into dollars. It will use the current exchange rate of $1.09.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Production Cost in \$} &= \text{Production Cost in €}\times{\text{Exchange Rate}}\\
&= \text{ € 4,560,000}\times{\text{1.09}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{ \$ 4,970,400}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

 

The production cost when converted into dollars is **$ 4,970,400**.

Next, we will identify the commission of Jarek by multiplying the sales and the percentage of sales commission.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Sales Commission} &= \text{Sales}\times{\text{\% Sales Comission}}\\
&= \text{ € 5,700,000}\times{\text{5\%}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{ € 285,000}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

 

The sales commission of Jarek is **€ 285,000**.

Next, we will deduct the sales comission from the sales in euros.

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Sales}&&\text{€ 5,700,000~}\\
\text{Sales Commission of Jarek}&&\underline{\text{~~~~(285,000)}}\\
\text{Total}&&\underline{\underline{\text{~€ 5,415,000}}}\\
\end{array}$$


 

The net sales is **€ 5,415,000**.

Next,  we will convert € 4,560,000 to dollars using the exchange rate of $1.03. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Net Sales in \$} &= \text{Net Sales in € }\times{\text{Exchange Rate}}\\
&= \text{ € 5,415,000}\times{\text{\$ 1.03}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{ \$ 5,577,450}}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 

The net sales when converted into dollars is **$ 5,577,450**.

We can now determine the gross profit in euros:

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Net Sales}&&\text{\$ 5,577,450}\\
\text{Production Cost}&&\underline{\text{(4,970,400)}}\\
\text{Gross Profit in €}&&\underline{\underline{\text{~~~~\$ 607,050}}}\\
\end{array}$$
As a conclusion, the projected gain from the proposed arrangement if the exchange rate was changed into $1.03/€. is **\$ 607,050**.

## c.

We are asked to determine the exchange rate to break even.
**Break even** happens when the revenue and expenses are the same. Hence, no gain or loss is recorded.

In order to determine the exchange rate to break even, we will divide the production cost in dollars by the net sales in euros. To visualize:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Break even Exchange Rate} &= \dfrac{\text{Production Cost in \$}}{\text{Net Sales in €}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$
We have already determined the production cost in dollars and the net sales in euros from the previous question which are $4,970,400 and € 5,415,000 respectively.
As a conclusion, the exchange rate for the company to break even is **\$ 0.92 per €**.

To sum it all up, the projected gain from the proposed arrangement at the current exchange rate of $1.09/€ is **\$ 931,950**. The projected gain from the proposed arrangement if the exchange rate was changed into $1.03/€. is **\$ 607,050**. Lastly,  the exchange rate for the company to break even is **\$ 0.92 per €**.
